Detailed Description

Base class and low-level protocol for a remotable object.

You can derive from this class to create an object for which other processes can hold references to it. Communication between processes (method calls, property get and set) is down through a low-level protocol implemented on top of the transact() API.

Definition at line 28 of file IBinder.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum

FIRST_CALL_TRANSACTION The first transaction code available for user commands.

LAST_CALL_TRANSACTION The last transaction code available for user commands.

PING_TRANSACTION IBinder protocol transaction code: pingBinder().

DUMP_TRANSACTION IBinder protocol transaction code: dump internal state.

INTERFACE_TRANSACTION IBinder protocol transaction code: interrogate the recipient side of the transaction for its canonical interface descriptor.

FLAG_ONEWAY Flag to transact: this is a one-way call, meaning that the caller returns immediately, without waiting for a result from the callee. Applies only if the caller and callee are in different processes.

Enumerator:

virtual bool gaia::core::IBinder::isBinderAlive ( ) const [pure virtual]

Check to see if the process that the binder is in is still alive.

Returns:
false if the process is not alive. Note that if it returns true, the process may have died while the call is returning.
virtual void gaia::core::IBinder::linkToDeath ( gaia::core::IBinder::DeathRecipient *  recipient,
uint32_t  flags = 0 
) [pure virtual]

Register the recipient for a notification if this binder goes away.

If this binder object unexpectedly goes away (typically because its hosting process has been killed), then DeathRecipient::binderDied() will be called with a reference to this.

The cookie is optional -- if non-NULL, it should be a memory address that you own (that is, you know it is unique).

Note:
You will only receive death notifications for remote binders, as local binders by definition can't die without you dying as well. Trying to use this function on a local binder will result in an INVALID_OPERATION code being returned and nothing happening.
This link always holds a weak reference to its recipient.
You will only receive a weak reference to the dead binder. You should not try to promote this to a strong reference. (Nor should you need to, as there is nothing useful you can directly do with it now that it has passed on.)

Implemented in gaia::core::Binder, and gaia::core::BinderSDKProxy.

virtual bool gaia::core::IBinder::pingBinder ( ) [pure virtual]

Check to see if the object still exists.

Returns:
Returns false if the hosting process is gone, otherwise the result (always by default true) returned by the pingBinder() implementation on the other side.

Implemented in gaia::core::Binder, and gaia::core::BinderSDKProxy.

virtual IInterface* gaia::core::IBinder::queryLocalInterface ( base::String  descriptor) [virtual]

Check if this IBinder implements the interface named by descriptor.

If it does, the base pointer to it is returned, which you can safely static_cast<> to the concrete C++ interface.

virtual bool gaia::core::IBinder::transact ( uint32_t  code,
const gaia::core::Parcel &  data,
gaia::core::Parcel *  reply,
uint32_t  flags = 0 
) [pure virtual]

Perform a generic operation with the object.

Parameters:
codeThe action to perform. This should be a number between FIRST_CALL_TRANSACTION and LAST_CALL_TRANSACTION.
dataMarshalled data to send to the target. Must not be NULL. If you are not sending any data, you must create an empty Parcel that is given here.
replyMarshalled data to be received from the target. May be NULL if you are not interested in the return value.
flagsAdditional operation flags. Either 0 for a normal RPC, or FLAG_ONEWAY for a one-way RPC.

Implemented in gaia::core::Binder, and gaia::core::BinderSDKProxy.

virtual bool gaia::core::IBinder::unlinkToDeath ( gaia::core::IBinder::DeathRecipient *  recipient,
uint32_t  flags = 0 
) [pure virtual]

Remove a previously registered death notification.

The recipient will no longer be called if this object dies. The cookie is optional. If non-NULL, you can supply a NULL recipient, and the recipient previously added with that cookie will be unlinked.

Implemented in gaia::core::Binder, and gaia::core::BinderSDKProxy.
